intro: Baptistonia pabstii, commonly known as the Pabst's beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom in late summer. Baptistonia pabstii is a perennial herb that is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with high elevations.
